title: Money expansion and new loans in CTO Bank

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The central bank buys <math alttext="$15,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$15,000</mtext></mstyle></math> worth of bonds in the open market from <math alttext="C T O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CTO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Bank. The banking system has limited reserves, and the required reserve ratio is <math alttext="10%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) Immediately after the central bank’s open-market bond purchase, will <math alttext="C T O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CTO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Bank’s liabilities increase, decrease, or stay the same? Explain.

(b) By what amount will <math alttext="C T O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CTO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Bank’s reserves change before any new loans are made? Explain.

(c) As a result of the central bank’s open-market purchase of bonds, what is the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans <math alttext="C T O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CTO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Bank can make? Explain.

(d) Calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can change throughout the banking system. Show your work.

(e) How will the change in the money supply in part (d) affect consumption spending and real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the short run? Explain.
